Judul: ENERGIES OF ADSORBED CATALYTIC INTERMEDIATES ON TRANSITION METAL SURFACES: CALORIMETRIC MEASUREMENTS AND BENCHMARKS FOR THEORY
Abstrak:
Better catalysts and electrocatalysts are
essential for the production and use of clean fuels with less
pollution and improved energy efficiency, for making
chemicals with less energy and environmental impact, for
pollution abatement, and for many other future technologies
needed to achieve environmentally friendlier energy supply
and chemicals industry. Crucial for rational design of better
catalyst and electrocatalyst materials is knowledge of the
energies of elementary chemical reactions on late transition
metal surfaces. This knowledge would also aid in designing
more efficient and stable photocatalysts and batteries for
harvesting and storing solar energy.
Kata Kunci: Energies, Adsorbed Catalytic Intermediates, Transition Metal Surfaces, Calorimetric Measurements, Benchmarks for Theory
